00048 #ifndef MAX_SUBID               /* temporary - duplicate definition protection */
00049 #ifndef EIGHTBIT_SUBIDS
00050 typedef u_long  oid;
00051 #define MAX_SUBID   0xFFFFFFFF
00052 #else
00053 typedef u_char  oid;
00054 #define MAX_SUBID   0xFF
00055 #endif
00056 #endif
00057 
00058 #ifndef HAVE_SOCKLEN_T
00059 typedef u_int socklen_t;
00060 #endif
00061 
00062 #ifndef HAVE_IN_ADDR_T
00063 typedef u_int in_addr_t;
00064 #endif
00065 
00066 #ifndef HAVE_SSIZE_T
00067 #if defined(__INT_MAX__) && __INT_MAX__ == 2147483647
00068 typedef int ssize_t;
00069 #else
00070 typedef long ssize_t;
00071 #endif
00072 #endif
00073 
00074     /*
00075      * Try to ensure we have 32-bit (and hopefully 64-bit)
00076      *    integer types available.
00077      */
00078 
00079 #ifndef HAVE_INT32_T
00080 #if   SIZEOF_INT == 4
00081 #define INT32_T int 
00082 #elif SIZEOF_LONG == 4
00083 #define INT32_T long 
00084 #elif SIZEOF_SHORT == 4
00085 #define INT32_T short 
00086 #else
00087 #define _INT32_IS_NOT_32BIT
00088 #define INT32_T int 
00089 #endif
00090 typedef INT32_T int32_t;
00091 #endif /* !HAVE_INT32_T */
00092 
00093 #ifndef HAVE_UINT32_T
00094 #ifdef HAVE_U_INT32_T
00095 typedef u_int32_t        uint32_t;
00096 #else
00097 #ifdef INT32_T
00098 typedef unsigned INT32_T uint32_t;
00099 #else
00100 typedef unsigned int     uint32_t;
00101 #endif
00102 #endif
00103 #endif /* !HAVE_UINT32_T */
00104 
00105 #ifndef HAVE_INT64_T
00106 #if SIZEOF_LONG == 8
00107 #define INT64_T long 
00108 #elif SIZEOF_LONG_LONG == 8
00109 #define INT64_T long long
00110 #elif   SIZEOF_INT == 8
00111 #define INT64_T int 
00112 #elif SIZEOF_LONG >= 8
00113 #define INT64_T long 
00114 #define _INT64_IS_NOT_64BIT
00115 #endif
00116 #ifdef INT64_T
00117 typedef INT64_T int64_t;
00118 #endif
00119 #endif /* !HAVE_INT64_T */
00120 
00121 #ifndef HAVE_UINT64_T
00122 #ifdef HAVE_U_INT64_T
00123 typedef u_int64_t        uint64_t;
00124 #elif defined(INT64_T)
00125 typedef unsigned INT64_T uint64_t;
00126 #endif
00127 #endif
00128 
00129     /*
00130      *  For the initial release, this will just refer to the
00131      *  relevant UCD header files.
00132      *    In due course, the types and structures relevant to the
00133      *  Net-SNMP API will be identified, and defined here directly.
00134      *
00135      *  But for the time being, this header file is primarily a placeholder,
00136      *  to allow application writers to adopt the new header file names.
00137      */
00138

00141 #include <net-snmp/library/snmp_api.h>

00143  * #include <net-snmp/library/libsnmp.h>

00146     typedef struct netsnmp_index_s {
00147        int          len;
00148        oid         *oids;
00149     } netsnmp_index;
00150 
00151 
00152     typedef struct netsnmp_void_array_s {
00153        size_t  size;
00154        void * *array;
00155     } netsnmp_void_array;
00156 
00157     /*
00158      * references to various types
00159      */
00160     typedef struct netsnmp_ref_void {
00161        void * val;
00162     } netsnmp_ref_void;
00163 
00164     typedef union {
00165         u_long  ul;
00166         u_int   ui;
00167         u_short us;
00168         u_char  uc;
00169         long    sl;
00170         int     si;
00171         short   ss;
00172         char    sc;
00173         char *  cp;
00174         void *  vp;
00175     } netsnmp_cvalue;
